content:
Diagnosis
	1. Left breast fibromatosis-like metaplastic carcinoma
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Left wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

	Radiotherapy
	1 Mar 2024 - 12 Apr 2024
	Whole breast radiotherapy 40Gy in 15 fractions with integrated boost to tumor bed

	Chemotherapy
	Not indicated given tumor characteristics and stage

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	No evidence of disease

	Current issues
	Mild post-radiotherapy skin changes

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today following completion of adjuvant radiotherapy. [redacted name] has tolerated treatment well with only grade 1 skin reaction which is now resolving. She reports good energy levels and has returned to work part-time. The surgical wound has healed well with good cosmetic outcome.

On examination, there is mild skin pigmentation in the radiotherapy field but no active concerns. No palpable masses or lymphadenopathy.

	Further investigations
	Annual mammogram to commence from January 2025

	Medication prescribed
	Tamoxifen 20mg daily to continue for 5 years

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 months
Surgical follow up arranged with Mr [redacted name] for July 2024

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor for tamoxifen side effects
Annual medication review

	Summary of information given to the patient
	Discussed expected recovery timeline and normal post-radiotherapy changes. Advised regarding breast awareness and prompt reporting of any new symptoms.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: ER positive, PR positive, HER2 negative, mTOR negative

cancer_timeline.value: Left wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
Completed whole breast radiotherapy 40Gy in 15 fractions with integrated boost to tumor bed

patient_facts.value: Mild skin pigmentation in radiotherapy field, no palpable masses or lymphadenopathy
Good energy levels, returned to work part-time

status_updates.value: Early stage left breast cancer treated with surgery and radiotherapy. Completed planned treatment with good tolerance and no evidence of disease
Continuing tamoxifen 20mg daily for planned 5 year course
Annual mammogram to commence from January 2025
Oncology review in 3 months, surgical follow up July 2024
